---
title: "Satellite Course Lectures"
---

These lectures are short (about 20 minutes when narrated) and are used throughout CoastWatch courses.  
Click the **eye** icon to open the lecture, or **download** to save the file.

```{python}
#| echo: false
#| warning: false
#| message: false

import pandas as pd
from IPython.display import HTML
from urllib.parse import quote

df = pd.read_csv("lectures.csv", encoding="utf-8-sig").fillna("")

EYE_SVG = (
    '<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="18" height="18" '
    'viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" '
    'stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round">'
    '<path d="M1 12s4-8 11-8 11 8 11 8-4 8-11 8S1 12 1 12z"></path>'
    '<circle cx="12" cy="12" r="3"></circle>'
    '</svg>'
)

DOWNLOAD_SVG = (
    '<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="18" height="18" '
    'viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" '
    'stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round">'
    '<path d="M21 15v4a2 2 0 0 1-2 2H5a2 2 0 0 1-2-2v-4"></path>'
    '<path d="M7 10l5 5 5-5"></path>'
    '<path d="M12 15V3"></path>'
    '</svg>'
)

def preview_icon(url: str) -> str:
    url = str(url).strip()
    if not url:
        return "—"
    return (
        f'<a href="{url}" class="cg-icon" target="_blank" rel="noopener" '
        f'aria-label="Preview lecture">{EYE_SVG}</a>'
    )

def download_icon(url: str) -> str:
    url = str(url).strip()
    if not url:
        return "—"
    # if you ever store repo-relative paths instead of full URLs, you can adapt here.
    return (
        f'<a href="{url}" class="cg-icon" target="_blank" rel="noopener" '
        f'aria-label="Download lecture">{DOWNLOAD_SVG}</a>'
    )

rows = []
for _, r in df.iterrows():
    title = str(r.get("title", "")).strip()
    purl  = str(r.get("preview_url", "")).strip()
    durl  = str(r.get("download_url", "")).strip()

    rows.append(f"""
      <tr class="cg-row">
        <td>{title}</td>
        <td>{preview_icon(purl)}</td>
        <td>{download_icon(durl)}</td>
      </tr>
    """)

table = f"""
<div class="cg-table-wrap">
<table class="code-gallery-table">
  <colgroup>
    <col style="width: 70%;">
    <col style="width: 15%;">
    <col style="width: 15%;">
  </colgroup>
  <thead>
    <tr>
      <th>Title</th>
      <th>Preview</th>
      <th>Download ↓</th>
    </tr>
  </thead>
  <tbody>
    {''.join(rows)}
  </tbody>
</table>
</div>
"""

HTML(table)
```
